content.description:
Start on the same holds as the classic warm-up

Work It

. Climb right using seams, a sloper, and a unique crimp. Top out on crimps.
content.location:
On the Child's Play Boulder, start as for

Work It

, and climb right.

content.description:
Work It is located to the right of '

Child's Play

.' Start on jugs, and trend left on the line of jugs. It is a good warm-up.
content.location:
It is on the North side of the

Child's Play

Boulder.

content.description:
Climb the obvious (EAST) facing inside corner crack on the "Idle Horse Block."

Crack is dirty but when it cleans up with more traffic this one will get more stars!!  Great crack/steam/slab climbing on solid stone!!
content.location: Located at the "Work And Play Area (WEST)."  The boulder can be seen from the Sisters Trail.

content.description: This is a short boulder problem and is slightly harder than the warm-up problem to the left.
content.location:
See the photos of the marked starting hold. This boulder problem is on the “

Child’s Play

” Boulder and right of “

Work It

.”

content.description:
Start matched on the low blocky hold on the far right side of the

The Troll Cave

.  Move up and left to a positive lip on the arete and do a big move to a jug, finishing with an easy topout.
content.location:
This is on the far right side of the

Troll Cave

.

content.description: This is a fun, little variation climbing out of the Troll Cave. Start on the jug for Troll Cave, but go up and right, utilizing a good sidepull that allows you to rock over a big foot. Bump your right out to a poor sidepull, mantle with your left, and then right go up to a jug.
content.location: This is on the right side of Troll Cave.

content.description:
Start low on two juggy holds underneath the overhang, just down and left of the start to the

Troll Cave

, V3.  Pull straight up with some powerful matching to gain a mellow topout.
content.location:
This is on the right side of the

Troll Cave

.

content.description:
Start on the low jug on the right of the wall. Work your way through awesome roof moves on good holds until the holds run out. Top out using a knob and a side pull rail. Either downclimb the easy terrain next to the tree, or walk off (about 150 feet) to the right.

For full value, don't use any holds above the lip. This involves a large, nearly horizontal dyno to a sharp jug. This variation bumps the grade up a couple on the V scale. You have to try this!
content.protection: A pad and someone to move it.
content.location:
If you just climbed

Inward Particle

(which you should because it is great), walk right along the wall you can see until you encounter The Troll Cave (maybe 40 feet). Alternately, if you are at the base of

Inward Particle

, walk around the tree to the right and you should see it.

content.description:
Start at

Starfish

, go up, and exit early up and straight over. Watch out for the tree if you fall.
content.location:
It is 10 feet left of

Guiding Light

.

content.description: Climb the EASTERN most arete on the "Play Thing Block."  Great rock, clean moves make this a nice little arete.  A must do if your in the area!!!
content.location: Located at the "Work And Play Area (WEST)."  The boulder can be seen from the Sisters Trail.

content.description:
Climb the right-angling seam and face just a few feet left of "

Dead To The World

."  Fun climbing on good stone.
content.location: Located at the "Work And Play Area (WEST)."  The boulder can be seen from the Sisters Trail.

content.description:
Climb the face and arete on the SOUTH-facing section of rock just left of "

Cut Out The Craze

." It is good climbing.
content.location: This is located at the "Work And Play Area (WEST)." The boulder can be seen from the Sisters Trail.

content.description: Climb the leftmost section of slab on "The Entry Slab."
content.location: This is located at the "Work And Play Area (WEST)" just inside the thick treeline and behind the "Idle Horse Block.

content.description:
Start is the same as for "

The Piano

."  Climb the right side arete through tricky moves to a very awarding finish.  Fun line and a good warm up for "

The Piano

."
content.location: Located on "The Piano Boulder" on the NORTH/EAST side of the "Work and Play area."

content.description: Start at two crimps, and go up and left on the arete with slopers to a mantel over a rock.
content.location:
It is 10 feet left of

Guilding Light

on the rock next to the tree.

content.description:
SDS with your left hand on the arete just below the horizontal seam and your right hand on the start hold for "

Face Right of Crack

". Bump the hands up each arete until you get to the shelf feature. Then reach up the right hand to the crack/seam and the left up the arete for an easy topout!
content.location:
This is directly behind the Guiding Light Boulder. You are staring at it when you step off the Guiding Light Boulder. Also it is directly to the left of "

Face Right of Crack

."

content.description:
Start in the little dihedral to the right of

Guiding Light

.  Start left hand on a crimp and right hand on an undercling (both below the obvious rail about head height).  High feet and small holds allow for a long static move to the top.  It is short and sweet.

There could possibly be a harder sit start addition to this problem.
content.location:
This is to the right of

Guiding Light A.K.A Round Up

on the same block.

content.description: Start on the far right side of the block and traverse left along some mean slopers/under cling moves.  Once you reach the corner on the right side get ready for the biz!!!.  Reach low and left onto a nice "Piano Rail" (crux) and pull hard up high into a sweet lay-back system.  Exit on the arete and right most face.  Cool line with falls as short as 2-3 feet.  It's the ultimate power low ball!!
content.protection: Pads are good and maybe a spot?
content.location:
From the "Child's Play boulder" walk NORTH/EAST while traversing the lower hill side until you reach this low ball traverse.

The (EAST SIDE) climbing of "The Work And Play Area" can also be reached by splitting off with the "Sisters Trail" and taking "The Hidden Fawn Trail" until you are down and to the EAST of the right most Sister.  Before the trail meets with the "Dedisse Trail" head left or (North) into a flat wooded area.  Walk about 50 yards and you will start to see "The Piano Boulder."

content.description:
Start at the sit start of

Guiding Light

(low crimps), and go up to the left arete. Match hands, and finish straight up the left side of the arete on crimps.
content.protection: A couple pads and a spotter would be nice.
content.location: Go to the Guiding Light Boulder in the Work & Play Area.

climbs.name: The Lukes... A.K.A. Loyalty To Skill

content.description:
Climb the steep crimps up the right-most side of the "Full Connection Wall."  The crack/book system to the right is not to be used.

This line is also still very dirty but the climbing is so good that it's a must climb in my mind!!
content.location:
From the "Child's Play Boulder" walk NORTH/EAST while traversing the lower hill side until you reach this low ball traverse.

OR...

The (EAST SIDE) climbing of "The Work And Play Area" can also be reached by splitting off with the "Sisters Trail" and taking "The Hidden Fawn Trail" until you are down and to the EAST of the right most Sister.  Before the trail meets with the "Dedisse Trail" head left or (North) into a flat wooded area.  Walk about 50 yards and you will start to see "The Piano Boulder."  Once at "The Piano Boulder" head right or (EAST) and slightly uphill until you pass some tall obvious over-hangs with solid rock slabs at there base.  Keep looking to your right or (North) for a small some-what hidden corner where the "Full Connection Wall" and its two lines can be found.

content.description: I can only assume this has been done before, but I felt it deserved to be added to the area as it is a fun line, because who doesn't like a nice layback feature?
content.location:
This is directly to the left of "

In An Order That Would Surprise You

" near the Child's Play Boulder.

content.description:
Sit start

Guiding Light

, go up 3 moves, then go left for 15 feet. After leaving the arete, use crimps to gain the top slopers, then mantel.
content.location: It is on the Guiding Light Boulder in Work & Play Area.

content.description:
Climb the obvious, center seam found in the middle of "The Piano Boulder."  It needs more cleaning and traffic but offers a good second warm-up before you get on "

The Piano

."  Cool line and will get better with time.  It may get easier as the line sees more ascents.
content.location: Located on "The Piano Boulder" on the NORTH/EAST side of the "Work and Play Area."

content.description:
Located just right of "Cause" is a nice two handed under-cling.  Start both hands under-clinging and work your feet up onto the slab.  Next punch out left to a good crimp and push on to the finish.  Fun top-out.

Maybe a little harder if you are short.  But there are good feet all over!!  Fun problem and for some this would be a great warm-up for some of the area test pieces.
content.location: Found in the "Work and play" area just off the Sisters trail on the "Pound Block."  "Just-Cause" starts on the under-cling on the right side of the block.

content.description: Climb the right-most section of rock on "The Entry Slab."
content.location: It is located at the "Work And Play Area (WEST)" just inside the thick treeline and behind the "Idle Horse Block".

content.description: Climb up the center of the "Particle Slab."  Very low angle climbing with a few surprisingly difficult moves.  This is classic friction bouldering for-sure!!
content.location:
Located at "The Work And Play Area (West)."  This slab can be found in the woods just right (East) and downhill past "

Guiding Light (A.K.A.) Round Up

" boulder.

climbs.name: In An Order That Would Surprise You

content.description:
Start from good holds at head height. For full value, start to the left on good feet and move your feet to the right across the slab. Find your way up the slabby face through very balancy and fun moves. It has an easy topout, the crux is mid-height.

Slab boulder problems don't get much better than this! This appears to have been climbed, but the status of the send is unknown. If you got the FA and have a name for it, let me know and I'll gladly change it.
content.location: It is 20 feet North of Child's Play Boulder.

content.description:
Start with a good left hand down low, right hand on a crimp.  Slap left to the arete and bump (don't grab the flake that looks like it's going to shatter).  Set your feet and dyno to the lip.  Mantle over.  For full value, don't use the Grill slab...I don't think it makes it easier anyway.

Let me know if I didn't get the FA of this.
content.location:
Right between

Cut out the Craze

, V2, and

Wise Crack

, V0-1.

content.description: Start on the North/East arete.  Power onto the arete  and climb the right side crimps up onto small foot placements (don't slip!!). Continue past a small arete pinch to better lay-back holds on the left side of the arete.  Slap your way up to the spooky final moves.  This is exciting all the way and trickier than it looks!!!
content.location: This is located in the "Work and Play Area."  Walk WEST and slightly uphill by about 50 or so yards and you will see this tall striking arete.  This is a great line with some thoughtful moves up high.

content.description: Climb the SOUTH facing face/arete on the far right (EAST) section of the "Idle Horse Block."
content.location: Located at the "Work And Play Area (WEST)."  The boulder can be seen from the Sisters Trail.

content.description: Climb the crimps on the left-most side of the "Full Connection Wall.  Still dirty but worth the time.  Good movement on good stone!!
content.location:
From the "Child's Play boulder" walk NORTH/EAST while traversing the lower hill side until you reach this low ball traverse.

OR...

The (EAST SIDE) climbing of "The Work And Play Area" can also be reached by splitting off with the "Sisters Trail" and taking "The Hidden Fawn Trail" until you are down and to the EAST of the right most Sister.  Before the trail meets with the "Dedisse Trail" head left or (North) into a flat wooded area.  Walk about 50 yards and you will start to see "The Piano Boulder."  Once at "The Piano Boulder" head right or (EAST) and slightly up hill until you pass some tall obvious over-hangs with solid rock slabs at there base.  Keep looking to your right or (North) for a small some-what hidden corner where the "Full Connection Wall" and it's two lines can be found.

content.description: Start matched on the rail in the Middle of the face on the Idle Horse Block.  Step feet high, steming with your right foot and huck 2 hands to the lip. Mantle straight out.
content.location:
Located in between

Cut Out The Craze Arete

and the

Wise Crack

dihedral on the Idle Horse Block.

content.description: Start on the underclings about stomach height.  Move up using the undercling rail to the right until you can gain the positive crimps.  Top out without using the obvious crack to the left.
content.location: This is directly behind the Guiding Light Boulder.  You are staring at it when you step off the Guiding Light Boulder.

content.description:
The stand start begins with a (RH) side-pull found at about shoulder height while the (LH) pulls off a polished micro-crimp.

Step on and work the right side arete via cool pinches/side-pulls while moving up to a thank you (LH) crimp that sets you up to hit the final jug that gives way to this cool fin like top-out feature.  Fun!!!

(SDS) about V2/3??  Start (RH) on the lowest right side pull on the arete.  With the (LH) on a low polished nothing hold!!  Finish is the same....

It's like "

Guiding Light

" but shorter and not as classic, but worth doing if you're in the area!!

Note:  Holds around the far right side of the arete are not to be use for this problem!!!  They are very dirty, crumbly, and possible not safe to climb on anyway!!
content.location: Located in the "Work and Play" area to the right of and behind the "Play Thing Block" hidden by an evergreen tree one will find a nice clean face/arete.  (SDS) and (STAND) start are possible and both are fun!!!

content.description:
Climb the face that's just a few feet left of "

Top-Heavy

."  They share the same finish.  Fun climbing.
content.location: Located at the "Work And Play Area (WEST)."  The boulder can be seen from the Sisters Trail.

content.description:
Climb the over-hanging (EAST) facing arete on the "Idle Horse Block."

A little Dirty but worth the effort.  Nice arete moves!!  A must do!!
content.location: Located at the "Work And Play Area (WEST)."  The boulder can be seen from the Sisters Trail.

content.description: Start matched down low on a right-leaning sloper, move left to good crimps on a rail, and set up to throw for the lip above. Mantel over.
content.location:
It is on the northeast side of the

Child's Play

Boulder.

content.description:
This is the stand-start to

Child's Play

.  Start on the good crimp rail and dyno to the lip and mantle.
content.location: North-east side of the boulder.

content.description: Climb up the crack and face in the center of "The Pound Block."  A good problem that only get's one start for being a bit dirty.  It just needs a few more ascents, but it's fun climbing.
content.location: From the 1st parking lot find the "Sisters Trail" and follow it all the way to the "Work And Play" area's WEST SIDE boulders.  Most of the WEST SIDE boulders are visible from certain point's on the "Sisters Trial."

content.description:
Start on the left side of the Piano Boulder with a low, left hand, jug sidepull and a right hand on the crimp rail. Pull up the arete to the same ending as

The Piano

.
content.location: This is on the left side of the Piano Boulder.

content.description:
On the left side of the Particle Face, you will find a small, right-facing corner for your right hand and a rounded knob for your left. Grab these, do a near hand foot match, and stand up.

This is kind of a one move wonder, but it is a good mantel challenge.
content.location:
It is on the left side of the Particle Face, maybe 8 feet left of

Inward Particle

.

content.description: Climb the center line on "The Entry Slab" via a small eye brow and lay-backing slab.
content.location: Located at the "Work And Play Area (WEST)" just inside the thick treeline and behind the "Idle Horse Block.
